newsitem.title: USA: US Plains fed cattle market thin at $65 - USDA.
newsitem.headline: US Plains fed cattle market thin at $65 - USDA.

text.p: Feedlot cattle markets in the U.S. were seen trading in earnest on Thursday following sluggish pre-Christmas activity, feedlot sources said.
Many in the industry took time off Tuesday because they did not expect to get much business done, with Christmas falling in the middle of the week this year.
There were light sales at $65.00 per cwt reported in Kansas, but the Texas Panhandle and western Oklahoma market was inactive, according to USDA and private sources.
About 1,200 head sold in Kansas at $65.00 for select and choice steers and heifers, steady with last week, they said.
